alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 10 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Blaine, Chouteau and Hill. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM MDT, Montana Department of Transportation reports snowmelt flooding that has led to water over roadways. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Havre, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Parker School, Agency, Azure, Sangrey, St. Pierre, Beaver Creek, Boneau, Box Elder, Fort Belknap, Gildford, Hays, Hingham, Lloyd, Lohman, Rocky Boy and Laredo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
